meanings.definition: To focus attention on someone or something.
meanings.sent1: During the school play, the teacher was limelighting the lead actor.
meanings.sent2: The speaker was limelighting the importance of recycling in her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The magician limelighting his disappearing act made the audience gasp in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The detective limelighting the key evidence in the case finally solved the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The coach limelighting the star player's skills motivated the team to victory.

meanings.definition: The practice of illuminating a stage or performer with a spotlight.
meanings.sent1: The concert's limelighting made the singer shine on stage.
meanings.sent2: The theater crew adjusted the limelighting to highlight the lead actor's solo.
meanings.sent3: The cat's love for limelighting itself in the sunbeam amused the family.
meanings.sent4: The limelighting on the ballerina created a magical atmosphere on stage.
meanings.sent5: The limelighting on the speaker emphasized every word of her powerful speech.

meanings.definition: The act of highlighting or showcasing someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The limelighting of the new product attracted many customers to the store.
meanings.sent2: The limelighting of the artist's work at the gallery drew in art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent3: The limelighting of the cake at the party made everyone eager for dessert.
meanings.sent4: The limelighting of the charity event raised awareness for the cause.
meanings.sent5: The limelighting of the student's achievements inspired others to excel.
